decoDesc.summary: According to the foliation introduced by Alessandro Bausi, f.1v contains a big cross of one-page size. It is followed by 11 illustrated pages, ff. 2r-7r. These pages include the Eusebian Apparatus (3+7 arrangement), followed by a «Fontana della vita» or «tempietto» or θόλος, the Short Cycle, set under arches made of coloured bands. The manuscript’s decorative features, Bluetenblattstil were not dated precisely, but the XIV century was proposed as a terminus non poste quem. They appear to all be by the same artist.
decoDesc.decoNote: The first miniature according to the sequence attested by Carlo Conti Rossini, Roger Schneider and Alessandro Bausi contains a big cross of one-page size, belonging to the same style as the rest.

decoNote.desc: The runs between and is placed under coloured arches, ornamented variously, that rest on curtained columns.
The run between . The artists adopts the same decorative devices used to frame the preceding letter. The Canons are placed under coloured arches, ornamented variously, that rest on curtained columns.

A representation of the follows, as is conventional, the Eusebian Apparatus. Highly stylized, it features four columns, an interlace pattern, and a low chancel. Above its cross-topped roof, there are two ostrich birds, sitting on the both sides of a tree. The caption inside the Tempietto, which normally highlights its symbolism, is vanishing but still visible. ኑባሬ፡ ሥርዐት፡ ዘኅብሩ፡ አርባዕቱ፡ ወንጌላት።

Carlo Conti Rossini's edition pp. 189-190 reads በጽፋ for በንጽፉ,ዓጋማ as ዓግማ, አበ፡ምኔት as አባ፡ምኔት, ዘአንገሥጋሠ as ዘአንገሥገሠ, omits በአፈ፡፲ወ፭፡ነቢያት. For this and more see also

As Roger Scnheider commented in his unpublished notes, 'La version A de Conti Rossini a du se trouver dans la parti du début, parmi les textes varies et n’a pas été photographiée. D’après les variantes graphies de A données par Conti Rossini, la copie plus récente que B. B n’a pas de colonnes. Photo p.2. Ligne pointillée au-dessus du texte.' Marie-Laure Derat's edition, thus, relies on the image taken by Roger Schneider and the apparatus of Conti Rossini for B. Roger Schneider's transcription of the text reads ምያዝያ for መያዝያ, በአፉሁ፡ለአቡና፡መጣዕ for በአፉሁ፡ለአቡነ፡መጣዕ. In the apparatus on p.189 Carlo Conti Rossini provides ጋግማ for ዓጋማ, which is not found in the original. The copy of this text will be provided further in this discription, here it is important to note that the copy reads እንቀርዖ for what was corrected into እንቀርዖ and በጽንፋ for what was corrected into በንጽፉ.

q.seg: To the glory of the Father and the Son and the Holy Spirit.

I have assinged gwǝlt, dedicated, secluded, I, ḥaṣāni Lālibālā, my royal name [is] Gabra Masqal on the third day of the month of Mayazyain 409th year of mercy, mighty man, who, by the power of the Cross of Jesus Christ is invincible by an enemy, son of Morārā, son of Zānsəyum, son of ʾĀsdā,

I granted Maṭāʿ of ʾAham, the name of
my wife [is] Masqal Kəbrā,fearer of God, Biḥat on the river Ḫaṣaro, ʾƎnqarʿo, christian Zaredā, including their lands and ʿĀgāmā's steep and Də’du‘, where neither ‘āqābē ṣanṣan, nor kantibā should interfere, where no other tax from anyone [sould be] set apart from ʾabbot of the monastery of Maṭāʿ. And whoever would violate it or defraud it or withdraw it, whether he would reign or provoke, whether he would be appointed or would hold rulership, whether appointed or displaced, who ever will restrain this gwǝlt, and this kǝsum, may he be excommunicated in front of the Father and the Son and the Holy Spirit, by the mouth of our father Maṭāʿ,by the mouth of ṗāṗāsāt, by the mouth of the 318 orthodox, by the mouth of 15 prophets, by the mouth of 12 apostles, Amen. Amen.

item.note: CCR 7 I parte = [5.0]: (II f. 7v), according to AB. In this case textual varians corresond to "B " in CCR, he comments on p.189 'B scrittura d'età incerta, forse del secolo XVIII.' I did not find any reason not date this document King's Lālibālā postmortem. On p. 190 Carlo Conti Rossini notes that 'A questo atto deve certo riferirsi il seguente, che pero nel ms. non trovarsi con esso collegato'. Derat rightly notes on p.55 that in the images done by Roger Schneider, 'les deux parties de l'acte n 7 sont inscrites en continue, au fol. 7v-8r...'. However, as Anais Wion noticed, there is a blank leaf behind the folio in Roger Schneider images, each time when the sequence of folia differs from what later Bausi would observe. This allowed us to conclude that it was Roger Schneider himself who put two folia, containing as he considered two parts of the same document, together. Taking in account this, as well as the formal completeness of the above presented document, I consider it here as full document.

item.q: In the Name of the Father and the Son and the Holy Spirit. I, Gabra Masqal, granted sixty fields of ʾAham to the church, so that they celebrate the commemoration of Maṭāʿ, so that he would beseech a reward for me in the Heavenly Kingdom. If there is someone who would violate it or defraud it, may he be excommunicated by the mouth of the Father and the Son and the Holy Spirit.
item.note: CCR 4 = [5.0]: (II f. 7v), according to AB. It is page 5 according to Roger Schneider. Carlo Conti Rossini comments on p. 185 : 'Atto indubbiamente apocrifo, che trae dal Gadla Libanos.'

msItem.note: [5.0] = CCR 19: (II f. 8r-v), according to AB. Textual variants corresponds to Conti Rossini's "A". Carlo Conti Rossini comments on pp.202-203: 'A scrittura del sec. XVI. La data corrisponde al 1321. Come è noto, ʿĀmda Ṣǝyon, passanti i primi tempi in cui aspramente combattè il clero, fu poi favorevolissime alla chiesa: un ms. del British Museum contiene sue donazioni alla cattedrale di Aksum, la storia delle sue guerre contro l'Adal ne celebra la pietà, e il Gadla ʾEwosṭātewos,che ne ricorda le presecuzioni de'primi anni di regno, ne piange la morte, chiamando "colonna della fede". Nella citata storia delle sue guerre, ed. Perruchon Ṣyon alle pagg. 10, 11, 16, 17, 30-31 sta cetramente a designare Aksum, che ancor oggi è comunemente così chiamata. Degna di osservazione è l'allusione alla poligamia del re, il che concorda pienamente con i dati della storia in quistione. Non potrebbe poi passarsi sollo silenzio la diversità di redazione fra gli atti di questo re e queilli di re Lālibālā'.

[5.2-6] = CCR 20: (II ff. 8v-10v), according to AB. I have devided this document into three parts, with of them following next. Roger Schneider noted in his notes 'The photo is of Conti Rossini's copy A. The text starts on page 6, after CR n 19, from which it is separated by a line of dots and strokes. The text continues on pages 11, 12, 13, and ends on page 14. The writing is similar to that of n 19'. The misplacement, observed by Roger Schneider, seems to be temporary, neither Conti Rossini, nor Alessandro Bausi observed anything similar. Carlo Conti Rossini commented on pp. 203 and 206 just the following: '"A" scrittura del sec. XVI. [...]. La data corrisponde al 1322. La regina qui nominata è Bǝlen Sabā:nella storia di re ʿĀmda Ṣǝyon,riferendosi fatti svoltisi alquanto piu tardi, si parla di Žān Mangaśā,che sembra fosse allora la favorita del re, verosimilmente la "moglie piu giovane" di cui altrove essa parla. Singolare è il nome della regina e da mettersi a paro con quello di Bǝlen Sagad,su di che non potrei che rinviare alle mie Note etiopiche, Roma 1894, p.14. In questo atto, i titolari delle cariche son tutti mutati. La regina stessa Bǝlen Sabā è a capo dell'ʾƎntartā,precisamente come le figlie di re Zarʾa Yāʿqob,poco piu d'un secolo piu tardi, governavano altre province. Il mā’ǝkala bāḥr è non piu il Gabru, che vi trovammo nel 1305, ma un Samāy, che potrebbesi identificare col Semeyšaḥal di cui parla la storia di re ʿĀmda Ṣǝyon a p. 103; nel governo di Dabra Māʿəṣo, Fəqura ʾEgziʾ ha lasciato il posto a Maṭre ʾEgziʾ; lo ʿaqābe saʿat di Maṭāʿ è ora Gabra Krəstos, e il śǝyyuma Zaredā è Zarʾa Dāwit, al posto di Yāʿbika ʾEgziʾ'.
It is still [5.2-6] = CCR 20: (II ff. 8v-10v), according to AB.

[5.6] = CCR 21: (II ff. 10v-11r), according to AB. Carlo Conti Rossini comments on pp. 206-207 the following: 'Scrittura del secolo XVI. [...]. La data corrisponde al 1323. Alle cariche consuete, i cui titolari non sono mutati, aggiungonsi il seyuma Aṣbi, non nominato, cioe il capo della provincia a NE dell'Enderta, sui contrafforti abissini dominanti il pian del sale e la regione dei Dancali, e l'awfari Degna. Questo Degna è certamente lo stesso che nelle guerre contro l'Adal nel 1332 comandava la cavalleria di destra dell'esercito reale (v. Storia, p.19 e 57); e questo incontro dei due testi è una riprova della loro autenticita. La carica di awfari sembra aver poi raggiunto un grande lustro, come parrebbe dalle donazioni alla cattedrale di Aksum da me odite.' Roger Schneider notes 'Follows immediately the numbers 20, from which it is separated by a line of dots and strokes. The writing is similar to that of n 20, but the hand is different, a little less trained and slightly smaller. The last line is on page 15'.

[5.8] = CCR 18: (II f. 11v), according to Alessandro Bausi. This document occurs twice, in CCR indicated as "A", 'scrittura del sec. XVI.' on p.201. Carlo Conti Rossini comments on p.202: 'Atto non datato, del tempo di re ʿĀmda Ṣǝyon, che dev'essere stato redatto fra il 1319. Infatti, il capo di Dabra Libānos è, in questo documento, ʿƎqbā ʾƎgziʾ: ora nel 1319 era ancora Asfeḥa, eletto verso la fine del secolo XIII, e nel 1322 era gia Gabra Krestos, che continuava a occupare tale carica ai tempi di re Sayfa Arʿad. ʿƎqbā ʾƎgziʾ va quindi collocato fra i due, e deve essere stato per pochissimo tempo alla direzione del convento.

item.q: To the glory of the Father and the Son and the Holy Spirit. I, ʿĀmda Ṣǝyon, granted to ʾabbā Maṭāʿ this gwəlt: Ṣǝdāʾ, ʾAsirā, Labāsiro, Gamāʾ, Zenā Kudo, ʾAd Ḥǝlmo, ʾOnā Sābāy, Sənāgā, Māryāle, Sarʿe, Lago, Wankab, the monastery of the monks of the church of martyrs ʾAnānyā, ʾAzāryā and Misāʾel, so that he may beseech a reward for me in the Heavenly Kingdom. If there is anyone who perverts it or violates it, may he be excommunicated. Translation: Roger Schneider's translator emended ወሚሳኤል (which I simply translitirate as 'Misāʾel') into 'Michael', noting 'sic' in the square brakets. ከመ፡ይትወሀሰኒ, which I translate as 'so that he may beseech a reward for me', he interprets as 'so that he may be my garantor'
item.note: [5.6] = CCR 24: (II f. 11r), according to AB. Carlo Conti Rossini comments on p. 211: 'Scrittura del secolo XVII. Atto di dubbia attendibilità, troppo scostandosi dalla forma consueta degli atti di ʿĀmda Ṣǝyon.' Roger Schneider repeats Conti Rossini, and concludes the following: 'Conti Rossini rightly doubts the authenticity of thic act, because the form of the text differs completely from the one used by ʿĀmda Ṣǝyon. He dates the writing to the XVIIth century. It is very poor and unskilled, difficult to date, but surely late.' Many of the place names of this act occur in CCR 1 too.

item.q: In the 35th year of Mercy, during the days of our King Zarʾa Yāʿqob, whose royal name is Qʷasṭanṭinos,25 years after he became a king, the one who granted a pillar to the church of Maṭāʿ, Tasfā ʾIyasus, səyum of Gəlomakada, son of Yəsmo. May He bless his soul, his wife and his children. May He write his name in the Book of the Life throught the prayers of Saint Maṭāʿ. And you, the holy ones, remember him and do not forget him in your prayers, unto the ages of ages, amen.

[5.10] = CCR 26: (II f. 12vb), according to AB. Conti Rossini comments on p.212: 'Scrittura del secolo XVII (?): colonna. [...]. La data corrisponde al 1459. Il donatore è il capo di Gelo Makada, oggi distretto fra Gunaguna e Addigrat, comprendente anche Dabra Maeso: consta infatti che già nella secondà metà del secolo XIV i capi di quel distretto cominciarono ad aver importanza e ad esercitare una certa influenza sulle regioni crcostanti. Ed è assai probabile che ne'secoli XIII, XIV ecc., non avendo l'Agame. A quanto pare, una unitànpolitica, andasse divso nei feudi di Dabra Maeso (cui poi sarebbe succeduto lo syum di Gelo Makeda), signoreggiante la parte orientale almeno fino agli alti monti ove ora è Endaga Hamus, e di altri capi (p.e. Dabra Damo, di Awgar Sanayt ecc.), che se ne sparvano le terre d'occidente.'

ab.note: The edition by Carlo Conti Rossini on p.202 contains በ፭፪ወ፭ instead of በ፭፻ወ፭, which seems to be a simple type-error, for non of the witnesses contain this date and it is not marked in the apparatus. It is proved by the date, 1321, which Carlo Conti Rossini must have counted from በ፭፻ወ፭. Further, it reads ውስተ፡ሀገሩ፡ዘመጣዕ, while it is ውስተ፡ሀገሩ in the manuscript, ወአልህምትሂ፡፲፪ instead of ወአልህምትሂ፡፲፻,ሰራዌልየ instead of ስራዌልየ and እሳየ instead of አሣእንየ.

ab.seg: To the glory of the Father and the Son and the Holy Spirit.
in 505 year of mercy, I, king ʿAmda Ṣǝyon, granted ’abbā Maṭā‘ of ’Aham so that he would beseech a reward for me in the Heavenly Kingdom,

182 [pieces] of gold, two crosses of gold and one dish of gold and one chalice of gold, one dish of silver and one chalice of silver, 103 rich vestments to the church of Maṭā‘ and to the holy ones 40 fine cloths, and 30 rich vestments and 1000 cows to the other churches in his land. And after all, I gave my own golden robe and my weapon and my two pans taken from my hip, and my pair of shoes from my feet. And all this I gave, knowing that the wealth of this world will pass, so that beloved Maṭā‘ would beseech a reward for me the Heavenly Kingdom, forever and ever, Amen.
ab.note: As Roger Schneider's translator relied on the edited text, his translation reads as "In the year of Mercy 525 year'; not 'in his land' but 'inside the land of Maṭā‘'; '12 cows' instead of 1000; ሰራዌልየ remains untranslated. Then, as was mentioned, I made a choice for as 'would beseech a reward for me for me', while Roger Scheider's translator offers 'may be my garantor'.

div.ab:
ወለንጉሥነ፡ዐምደ፡ጽዮን፡ዘአዕበዮ፡እምነገሥተ፡ምድር፡ያኑኅ፡መዋዕሊሁ፡በዲበ፡ምድር፡ወይረስዮ፡እግዚኣብሔ፡ሥሩዐ፡ከመ፡ወርኅ፡ወብሩሀ፡ከመ፡ፀሓይ፡ወይዕቀብ፡አንስትያሁ፡ወደቂቁ፡ወደቂቀ፡ደቂቁ፡ወዓዲ፡ያድኅኖሙ፡ለሰራዊቱ፡እምስረተ፡ኀጽ፡ወውግረተ፡እብን።ወያግርር፡
ጸሮ፡ወጻላእቶ፡በዕለተ፡ሞቱሂ፡ይኈልቆ፡ምስለ፡ቅዱሳን፡ወሰማዕት፡ምስለ፡እለ፡አስመርዎ፡ለእግዚኣብሔር፡ምስለ፡ዳዊት፡ወቈስጠንጢኖስ፡ወአኖርዮስ፡ለዓለመ፡ዓለም፡አሜን።

And for our King ʿAmda Ṣǝyon, who was made the greatest among the kings on the earth, may God extend his days on the earth and may God make him set firmly as the Moon and splendid as the Sun and may He protect his wives and his children and children of his children and may He save his army from the flying dart and from throwinging of a stone. And may He subdue his enemy and his adversaries. And on the day of his death, may He count him among the saints and martyrs and among those who pleased God, with Dawit and Qwosṭanṭinos and ʾAnoryos, for ever and ever, Amen. Translation: What I translate as 'who was made the greatest among the kings on the earch', Roger Schneider's translator offers 'whom he has elevated above the kings of the earch'; for my 'splendid as the Sun' he offers 'bright as the Sun'; for my 'may He protect his wives...' he offers 'may he keep his wives'; for my 'may He save his army from the flying dart' he offers 'may he protect his armies from the piercieng of arrows'; for my 'from throwinging of a stone' he offers 'from being crushed by stones'; for my 'those who pleased God' he offers 'among those who exalted God'.
ወአንትሙሂ፡ቅዱሳን፡እለ፡ሀለውክሙ፡ውስተ፡መካነ፡መጣዕ፡ጸልዩ፡ለ ንጉሥ፡ዐምደ፡ጽዮን፡ሰርከ፡ወነግሀ፡ሌሊት፡ወምዐልተ፡ቀትረ፡ወሰዐተ፡በውስተ፡ቊርባንሂ፡ወበውስተ፡ማኅበርሂ፡ወኀበ፡ተጋባእክሙሂ፡ለዓለመ፡ዓለም፡አሜን። ።

And you, the holy ones, those who dwells in the place of Maṭāʿ, pray for the King ʿAmda Ṣǝyon, at the evenings and at the daybreak, at time of noons, and at the hour of Qwǝrbān and during the māḫbar and by assembling, forever and ever, Amen.

ab.note: Roger Schneider, as I can judge from his transcription, read ከመ፡ይወኀሰኒ what I read as ከመ፡ይወኀሰኒ, this must be a simple error. Roger Schneider read ዕራቅየ what I read as ዕሬቅየ and what Carlo Conti Rossini on p. 20 read as ዕረቅየ. Roger Schneider reads ኢዘተሰይም what I read as ኢዘተሰይመ, what also seems to be a simple error by transcribing. To ኢዘነገሠ Roger Schneider gives a comment that 'Sic ms. Read probably ነግሠ፡ Conti Rossini, p. 204, line 1, gives ተነግሠ, but this form is not otherwise attested'. In the photo by Alessandro Bausi the reading is as I present here. What I read as ወ፳፡ልብሰ, Roger Schneider read as ወአ፡ልባሰ, while Carlo Conti Rossini read as ወአልባስ. This reading is not clear, but there are definetly two dotts after two first characters. በ፭፻፡ወ፯ Carlo Conti Rossini reads on p. 203 as በ፭፻፡ወ፮, ብሌን፡ሰባ as ብሌን፡ሳባ, noting ብሌን፡ሰባ as a variant reading in "A". ዘኢይበኦ ܸConti Rossini emended on the basis of "B" reading as ዘኢይበውኦ two times. ቃል፡ነጋሲ Conti Rossini reads as ቃለ፡ነጋሲ, which is also in "B", but it is not marked in the apparatus. ስይምተ፡እንትርታ Conti Rossini reads as ሠየምተ፡እንትርታ, which can not be interpreted otherwise as an error. ወበዘ፡ይመጽእ Conti Rossini read as ወበዝ፡ይመጽእ. እግዚእየ፡ንጉሥ Conti Rossini erroneously read እግዚእነ፡ንጉሥ. Conti Rossini emended ሖሪ as ሑሪ. At the end Roger Schneider notes in brackets that 'a line of dots and strokes as a separation.'

ab.seg: To the glory of the Father and the Son and the Holy Spirit.

In the 507th year of Mercy, I,Bǝlen Sabā,the lady of Biḥat,wife of ʿĀmda Ṣǝyon,the king,because of the love to Maṭāʿ, so that he would beseech a reward for me in the Heavenly Kingdom, while I shall stay naked infront of the Heavenly King, Galabāand ʾƎnqarʿo, I gave this gwəlt to blessed Maṭāʿ, my beloved, which should not penestrate neither a horse nor a lion, neither a sǝyum of Dabra Māʿəṣo nor a sǝyum of Zaredā, neither an appointed one, nor the deposed one, neither the one who reigns nor who is agitated, neither
the spokesman of nǝguś, nor children of the palace. And if there is anyone who frauds or violates this gwəlt, which I granted to ʾabbā Maṭāʿ of ʾAham, while the kingʿĀmda Ṣǝyonand while the sǝyum of ʾƎntartā Bǝlen Sabā the lady of Biḥat and while māʾǝkala baḥǝr Samāy, and while sǝyum of Dabra Māʿəṣo Maṭre ʾEgziʾ, and while sǝyum of Zaredā Zarʾa Dāwit, and while ʿaqābe saʿata Maṭāʿ Gabra Krəstos. I gave this, knowing that the whole world will pass, and I have heard the word of Ecclesiastes saying, 'Vanity, all is vanity, unless one prepares his provisions beforehead alive'. And I gave to Maṭā‘ and to the holy ones 150 cows and linen vestments and I loaded offerings that I brought from ʾAmḥarā. If there will be anyone who usurps this gwəlt which I gave for offering and for commemoration of my beloved Maṭāʿ, may he be excommunicated by the mouth of the 15 prophets and by the mouth of 12 Apostles, by the mouth of 318 righteous of faith, by the mouth of Ṗeṭros liqa ṗāṗāsāt, by the prayer of the blessed Maṭāʿ and by the mouth of the Father. And the Son and the Holy Spirit may he be excommunicated in this world
and in the world that comes. This [transgression] can not be released through fasting or prayer, begging or bows for ages of ages, Amen. I offered this gwəlt and did all this as my lord King ʿĀmda Ṣǝyon ordered me, saying, 'Go, come to Maṭāʿof ʾAham and do the will of the blessed Maṭāʿ, my beloved. And say: "Do not abandon, o Lord, my Lord ʿĀmda Ṣǝyon in the days of his youth"'. So I came and cried, wept and rolled myself on the grave of Maṭāʿ as ordered me my lord ʿĀmda Ṣǝyon. 'Do for him, o Lord, according to the desire of his heart, saying "Give ʾƎnqarʿo and Galabā, so that God give me in return for this little a lot in the Heavenly Kingdom, amen." May God give hime in return of a litle - great, amen. May God give him in return for that on the earth - that on the heaven, amen. In return for what ages - what does not age, amen. In return perished - what does not perish, amen. And may He prolong his days on the earth, amen. And may He subdue his rival
and his enemies, amen. And may he forgive his sins and obliterate the book of his debts, amen. May God give him wisdom as to Solomon, amen. May God give him benevolence as to Dāwit, amen. May God give him patience as to ʾƎyob, amen. May God give him victory as to ʾIyāsu, amen.

div.ab:
ወለይእቲኒ፡ብሌን፡ሰባ፡በዐልተ፡ቢሐት፡የሀባ፡እግዚኣብሔር፡ፍቅረ፡ምስለ፡ምታ፡ዐምደ፡ጽዮን፡ዘገብረት፡ፈቃዶ፡በመልእክናሃ፡በከመ፡ገብር፡ብፁዕ፡ኄር፡ዘያስተፈሥሕ፡እግዚኡ፡በመልእክቱ፡ከማሁ፡ሠናየ፡ገብረት፡በመልእክታ፡የሀባ፡እግዚኣብሔር፡ዕሴተ፡ሠናየ፡አሜን።የሀባ፡እግዚኣብሔር፡መዋዕለ፡ብዙኅ፡በፍሥሐ፡ዘአልቦ፡ሐዘነ፡ምስለ፡ምታ፡ዐምደ፡ጽዮን፡አሜን።ወአመ፡ዕለተ፡ጽዋዓሆሙ፡ያስምዖሙ፡እግዚኣብሔር፡ቃለ፡ፍሥሓ፡ዘይብል፡ንዑ፡ኀቤየ፡ቡሩካኑ፡ለአቡየ፡ትረሱ፡መንግሥተ፡ዘአስተዳለወ፡ለክሙ፡እምቅድመ፡ዓለም፡አሜን።ወይባርክ፡ውሉዶሙ፡አሜን፡ወያብዝኅ፡ዘርኦሙ፡ከመ፡ኮከበ፡
ሰማይ፡ወከመ፡ኆጻ፡ባሕር፡አሜን፡ወአሜን። ወይበል፡ኵሉ፡ሕዝብ፡አሜን፡ወአሜን።
div.note: ብሌን፡ሰባ is ብሌን፡ሳባ in Conti Rossini's edition, ዘገብረት is ዘገብረ.

div.ab:
And for this Bǝlen Sabā the lady of Biḥat, may God give her love with her husbandʿĀmda Ṣǝyon, who fullfilled his will with her authority, as a good blessed servant that pleases his lord by his service, like this she did good by her service. May God give her good reward, amen. May God give her many days in joy, which do not have sadness, with her husbandʿĀmda Ṣǝyon,amen. And on the day of their summons may God announce them the word of joy saying: 'Come to me blessed by Father, inherit the kingdom, which was prepared for you from before the world, amen.' And may He bless their children, amen and may He multiply their seed like the stars of
heaven and like the sand of the sea, amen and amen. And let all people say 'Amen and amen'.
div.note: For ወለይእቲኒ, which I translate as 'And for this', Roger Schneider's translator has 'And to her'; በከመ፡ገብር፡ብፁዕ፡ኄር፡ዘያስተፈሥሕ፡እግዚኡ, which I translate as 'as a good blessed servant that pleases his lord' he translates as 'like a praiseworthy, diligent slave who pleases his master'; በመልእክታ I translate as 'by her service', while he offers 'through her errand'; እምቅድመ፡ዓለም I translate as 'from before the world', he offers 'from the foundation of the world'.

div.ab: ወኵልክሙ፡እለ፡አንበብክሙ፡ጸልዩ፡ለንጉሥ፡ዐምደ፡ጽዮን፡ወለንግሥት፡ብሌን፡ሰባ፡ከመ፡ይምሐሮሙ፡እግዚኣብሔር፡በሰማይ፡ወበምድር፡ለዓለመ፡ዓለም፡አሜን፡ወአሜን።
div.note: Conti Rossini reads ብሌን፡ሰባ as ብሌን፡ሳባ. Transcription by Roger Schneider omits በሰማይ.

div.ab: And all you who read [it], pray for our king ʿĀmda Ṣǝyon and for our quenn Bǝlen Sabā, so that God show mercy on them in heaven and on earth forever and ever, amen and amen.

በአኰቴተ፡አብ፡ወወልድ፡ወመንፈስ፡ቅዱስ፡ አነ፡ዐምደ፡ጽዮን፡ ወሀብኩ፡አንፈ፡በዐት፡ማርያም፡ዘሰዐጋ፡ሕፄን፡ይግበሩ፡ሎቱ፡ተዝካሩ፡ለመጣዕ፡ወሊተሂ፡ከመ፡ትዘከረኒ፡እግዚእትየ፡ማርያም፡በጸሎታ፡በኀበ፡ፍቁር፡ወልዳ፡ወዘአጐለትኩ፡በ፭የወ፯፡ዓመተ፡ምሕረት፡አነ፡ዓምደ፡ጽዮን፡እንዘ፡ሥይምተ፡እንትርታ፡ብሌን፡ሰብአ፡ እንዘ፡መእከለ፡ባሕር፡ሰማይ፡ ወእንዘ፡አውፋሪ፡ ድግና፡ እመቦ፡ዘተሐየለ፡እማርያም፡ዘሰዐጋ፡ አንፈ፡በዓት፡ሕፄን፡ዘወሀብኩ፡አነ፡ዐምደ፡ጽዮን፡እመቦ፡ ዘተሐየሎ፡ወዘተአገሎ፡እመሂ፡ማእከለ፡ባሕር፡ወእመሂ፡ሥዩመ፡እንትርታ፡ወእመሂ፡አውፋሪ፡ወእመሂ፡ሥዩም፡አጽቢ፡እመሂ፡ኅዱግ፡ወቃል፡ነጋሢ፡ውጉዛን፡ይኩኑ፡አሜን፡በአፈ፡ጴጥሮስ፡ሊቀ፡ጳጳሳት፡አሜን፡በአፈ፡፫፻፡፲ወ፷፡ርቱዓነ፡ሃይማኖት፡አሜን።ወበማርያም፡ወላዲ
ተ፡አምላክ፡ውጉዛነ፡ለይኩኑ፡አሜን።
div.note: Conti Rossini reads ሥይምተ as ሥይመተ, ዘተሐየለ as ዘተሐየሎ, ወዘተአገሎ as ወዘተአገቦ, ቃል፡ነጋሢ as ቃለ፡ነጋሢ. Both Conti Rossini and Roger Schneider read my መእከለ፡ባሕር፡ሰማይ as መእከለ፡ባሕር፡ስማይ. Roger Schneider did three notes not the text: 1.(ሕፄን) The two letters ፄን፡ are smaller and seem to have been written over an erasure. 2.(ለመጣዕ) መጣ has been written later over an erasure. 3.([አንፈ፡በዓት]፡ሕ[ፄን፡])The passages between brackets have been written over an erasure, by a later hand.

div.ab:
To the glory of the Father and the Son and the Holy Spirit. I, ʿĀmda Ṣǝyon granted ʾAnfa Baʿat [to] Māryām za-Saʿagā Ḥǝṣen so that they celebrate the commemoration of Maṭāʿ and for me, so that my Lady Mary remember me in her prayer to her beloved Son. It was in 507 year of Mercy that I granted gwǝlt, I, ʿĀmda Ṣǝyon, while sǝyǝmt of ʾƎntǝrtāBǝlen Sabā, whilemaʾǝkala bāḥrSamāy, and while ʾawfāri Dǝgnā. If there is anyone who usurps from Māryām za-Saʿagā ʾAnfa Baʿat Ḥǝṣen, which I,ʿĀmda Ṣǝyongranted, if there is anyone who violates or defraudes it, if even maʾǝkala bāḥr or sǝyum of ʾƎntǝrtā, if even ʾawfāri or sǝyum of ʾAṣbi, if even a deputy or a spokesman of nǝgus, may they be excommunicated, amen, by the mouth of Ṗeṭros liqa ṗāṗāsāt, amen; by the mouth of 318 righteous of faith, amen. And by Māryām, bearer of
Lord, may they be excommunicated, amen.
div.note: ወሀብኩ I translate as 'I granted', while Roger Schneider's translator has it as 'I have given'; ይግበሩ፡ሎቱ፡ተዝካሩ I translate as 'they celebrate the commemoration', while he offers 'they [the priests] may celebrate the commemoration'; እንዘ፡መእከለ፡ባሕር፡ሰማይ, which I interprete as 'whilemaʾǝkala bāḥrSamāy', he misinterpreted as '[that of] Maʾǝkala Bāḥr, Semay'; ወዘተአገለ I translate as 'defraudes it', while he has 'transgresses', marking Conti Rossini's 'ወዘተአገቦ' in square brakets with a question mark; እመሂ፡ማእከለ፡ባሕር, which I translate as 'if even maʾǝkala bāḥr', he has misinterpreted again into 'be it the [governor of] Maʾǝkala Bāḥr'; ወቃል፡ነጋሢ, which I translate as 'a spokesman of nǝgus', he translates as 'a king's proxy'.

div.ab:
በአኰቴተ፡አብ፡ወወልደ፡ወመንፈስ፡ቅዱስ፡ አግባእኩ፡አነ፡ ክርስቶስ፡አቡሁ፡በአፈ፡ዐምደ፡ጽዮን፡ንጉሥ፡ተርካ፡ዘቀዳሚ፡ምድሮሙ፡ለቅዱሳን፡እለ፡ቤተ፡መጣዕ፡እንዘ፡ዐቃቤ፡ሰዐት፡ዕቅባ፡እግዚእ፡ወእመ፡ቦ፡ዘተኀየሎሙ፡ወዘተአገሎሙ፡ለቅዱሳን፡ይእቲ፡ምድር፡በጽንፋ፡ወበቀልቀላ፡ለተርካ፡ውጉዘ፡ለይኩን፡በቅድመ፡አብ፡ወወልድ፡ወመንፈስ፡ቅዱስ፡በአ
ፈ፡፫፻፡፲ወ፷፡ርቱዐነ፡ሃይማኖት፡ወበአፈ፡፲ወ፭፡ነቢያት፡ወበአፈ፡፲ወ፪፡ሐዋርያት፡ወበአፈ፡ጴጥሮስ፡ሊቀ፡ጳጳሳት፡ዘኢይትፈታሕ፡በጾም፡ወበጸሎት፡በስኢል፡ወበሰጊድ፡ለዓለመ፡ዓለም፡አሜን፡ወአሜን፡ለይኩን፡ለይኩን።ወእመቦ፡ዘደምሰሳ፡ወዘቀደዳ፡በጽልሑት፡ከማሁ፡ለይኩን፡ውጉዘ፡ለዓለመ፡ዓለም፡አሜን። በቅድመ፡አብ Conti Rossini has as በአፈ፡አብ. Roger Schneider had one comment to this text: 1.ዐቃቤ፡ሰዓት has been erased, but the letters are still faintly discernible. The copy B still has it.

To the glory of the Father and the Son and the Holy Spirit. I, Krǝstos ʾAbuhu,restored, by the mouth ofKing ʿĀmda Ṣǝyon, Tarkā, previously the land of the holy ones of the church of Maṭāʿ, while ʿaqābe saʿat ʿƎqbā ʾƎgziʾ. And if there is anyone who would violate or pervert from the holy ones this land, [even] on the borders or cliffs of Tarkā, may he be excommunicated in front of the Father and the Son and the Holy Spirit by the mouth
of 318 righteous in faith and by the mouth of 15 prophets and by the mouth of 12 apostles and by the mouth of Ṗeṭros liqa ṗāṗāsāt, that will not be forgiven through fasting or prayer, through vows or bows unto the ages of ages, amen and amen. May it be so, may it be so. And if there is anyone who erase it or who scratch it in deceit, may he be likewise excommunicated unto the ages of ages, amen. Roger Schneider's translator offers 'have brough in' for አግባእኩ, which I translate as 'restored'; ወእመ፡ቦ፡ዘተኀየሎሙ፡ወዘተአገሎሙ he has as 'if there is anyone who snaches or usurps', which I translate as 'would violate or pervert'; በጽንፋ፡ወበቀልቀላ he translates as 'on the edges and slopes', while I translate as 'on the borders or cliffs'; በቅድመ፡አብ, which I translate as 'in front of the Father', he has as 'by the mouth of the Father', which shows that he was translating from Conti Rossini's edition. ዘኢይትፈታሕ, which I translates as 'that will not be forgiven', he translates as 'which [excommunication] will not be revoked'; ወእመቦ፡ዘደምሰሳ፡ወዘቀደዳ፡በጽልሑት I translate as 'if there is anyone who erase it or who scratch it in deceit', while he translates it as 'if there is anyone who with a bad intention erases or tears it'.

በአኰቴተ፡አብ፡ወወልድ፡ወመንፈስ፡ቅዱስ:ጸሐፍነ፡ኀቢረነ፡ወሠሚረነ፡ተጋቢአነ፡ቅዱሳን፡ዐቃቤ፡ሰዓት፡ዘቤተ፡መጣዕ፡ከመ፡ኢያውፅኡ፡አልባሰ፡ዘመጣዕ፡ኢዐቢየ፡ወኢንኡሰ፡ወኢየሀቡ፡ለቤተ፡መጣዕ፡ወለእመቦ፡ዘወሀበ፡ለመርዓ፡እምነ፡አልባስ፡ዘአባ፡መጣዕ፡እመሂ፡፩ ወእመሂ፡ቀይሰ፡ገበዝ፡ወእመሂ፡መነኮሳት፡እመሂ፡ዓቢይ፡ወእመሂ፡ንኡስ፡እመሂ፡ሥዩም፡ወእመሂ፡ሥዑር፡ለእመቦ፡ዘአውፅአ፡ በቅድመ፡አብ፡ወወልድ፡ወመንፈስ፡ቅዱስ፡ለዓለመ፡ዓለም፡አሜን፡ወአሜን፡ለይኩን፡ለይኩን፡አሜን።

በአኰቴተ፡አብ፡ወወልድ፡ወመንፈስ፡ቅዱስ: ዘወሀቡ፡ቀደምት፡ተርከ፡ለአቡነ፡ሊባኖስ፡ወአነሂ፡ተንሥአ፡ክርስቶስ፡ወሀብኩ፡ወአግባእኩ፡ዘተገፍዐ፡ተርከ፡አነ፡ ከመ፡ይትወሐሠኒ፡መጣዕ፡በመንግሥተ፡ሰማያት፡ከመ፡ይግበሩ፡ተዝከርየ፡ደቂቀ፡መካን፡ወኢይርስዑኒ፡በጊዜ፡ጸሎት፡ሰሚዕየ፡ዘይቤ፡ቃለ፡ሰሎሞን፡መክብብ፡ከንቱ፡ከንቱ፡ለዓለም፡ንብረ ቱ፡ዘእንበለ፡ዘገብረ፡ሥንቁ፡በመዋዕለ፡ሕይወቱ፡የሀቦ፡እግዚአብሔር፡ለተንሥአ፡ክርስቶስ፡ መንግሥተ፡ሰማያት፡ህየንተ፡ኅዳጥ፡ብዙኅ፡አሜን፡የሀቦ፡እግዚአብሔር፡ህየንተ፡ንስቲት፡ዓቢይ፡የሀቦ፡እግዚአብሔር፡ህየንተ፡ዘቦ፡ምድር፡ዘበ፡ሰማያት፡ወያኑኅ፡መዋዕሊሁ፡በዲበ፡ምድር፡ወያግርር፡ፀሮ፡ወጸላእቶ፡አሜን።ወይስረይ፡ኃጢአተ፡ወይደምሰስ፡መጽሐ ፈ፡ዕዳሁ፡አሜን።ወለእመቦ፡ዘሄዳ፡ወዘተአገላ፡ውጉዘ፡ለይኩን፡ዘኢይትፈታሕ፡በጾም፡ወበጸሎት፡በአፉሁ፡ለአቡነ፡መጣዕ፡አሜን።

ab.seg: To the glory of the Father and the Son and the Holy Spirit.

div.ab: ወሀብኩ፡አነ፡ይሥምከ፡እግዚእ፡ሥዩመ፡ኀማሳን፡ለአባ፡መጣዕ፡ዘአሀም፡ፈዋሴ፡ዱያን፡ኀበ፡ተቀብረ፡አዕጽምቲሁ፡፭፡ነፍሰ፡ሰብእ፡ገድቦ፡ምስለ፡ብእሲቱ፡ወደቂቁ፡ከመ፡ይትወሐሰኒ፡መጣዕ፡በመንግሥተ፡ሰማያት፡ወያኑኅ፡መዋዕልየ፡በዲበ፡ምድር፡ወይዕቀብ፡ነፍስየ፡ወሥጋየ፡ምስለ፡አንስትያየ፡ወደቂቅየ፡ወዘመድየ፡ወበቀዳሚ፡ወሀብኩ፡መንጦላዕተ፡በርኴናየት፡እስመ፡ስማዕኩ፡ቃለ፡መክብብ፡ዘይቤ፡ኵሉ፡ከንቱ፡ከንቱ፡ውእቱ፡ዘኢገብረ፡ሠናየ፡በሕይወቱ።ወበዐጋማሂ፡አር5ዕኩ፡ጕልተ።

ወእንዘ፡ሀለዉ፡ክልኤሆሙ፡ኅቡረ፡ላሊበላ፡ንጉሥ፡ወብእሲቱ፡መስቀል፡ክብራ፡በአልተ፡ቢሐት፡ከመ፡ይኩኖሙ፡መድኀኒተ፡ነፍሶሙ፡በመንግሥተ፡ሰማያት፡ወለብእሲትየኒ፡ከመ፡ይደምራ፡ምስለ፡ቅድ ሳት፡ምስለ፡ሳራ፡ወሰራሜ፡ምስለ፡ሐና፡ወሶፍያ፡ወኢይዝክር፡ላቲ፡ኀጢአታ፡ወይደምስስ፡መጸሐፈ፡ጌጋያ፡አሜን።ወአሜን።ለይኩን፡ለይኩን።ወእንዘ፡ሀለዉ፡ዓበይተ፡܆ብጕና፡ ቃለጳስ፡አብት፡ ጳጳስ፡አባ፡ጊዮርጊስ፡ ወኤጲስ፡ቆጶስ፡ኀረዮ፡ ዓቃቤ፡ሰዓት፡መጣዕ፡ይርድአነ፡ክርስቶስ፡ ሊቀ፡ዲያቆናት፡ሰውን፡ ቀይሰ፡ገበዝ፡ጽዮን፡አብ፡ይኩን፡ መልሐዘ፡ይትባረክ፡ ቀስ፡ሐጺን፡ዘአዶናየ፡ ጸዋር፡ናርጌ፡መኣሰሬ፡ክርስቶስ፡ብነ፡ ጸሐፍ፡ላም፡ስብሐት፡ ሐስጓ፡ይዕቀበነ፡ ማእከለ፡ባሕር፡ኣስገደ፡ ዓቃ፡ጸንጸን፡ባራ፡ጽዮን፡ ዐቃብ፡ደጌ፡ማሰረይ፡ይምሐረነ፡ ሊቀ፡አቀይታት፡ዘረውድም፡ እንዘ፡ ሊቀ፡ኬኖት፡ዘአመላይ፡ ወእንዘ፡ ሊቀ፡ኅዳር፡ያሞ፡ ሊቀ፡መሰንቆ፡ወልደ፡ብጕናይ፡ ወከመዝ፡ኣጐላትኩ፡ዘኣልቦ፡ግብረ፡ወገብጋበ፡መፍቀሬ፡እግዚአብሔር፡ዘወሀበ፡ላሊበላ፡ዘንተ፡ጕልተ፡ዘገፍዓ፡ውጉዘ፡ለይኩን፡አሜን፡ዘንተ፡ዘአጽሐፈ፡ ዐቃቤ፡ስዐተ፡መጣዕ፡ስመ፡ልደቱ፡ይርድአነ፡ክርስቶስ፡ከመ፡ምንኵስናሁ፡ጸጋ፡መጣዕ፡ ለዘአጽሐፈ፡ወለዘጸሐፈ፡ስረዩ፡ወባርኩነ፡ኣሜን።

And while two were united, KingLālibālāandhis wifeMasqal Kǝbrabaʾalt of Biḥat, so that it become salvation of their souls in the Heavenly Kingdom, and for my wife may it associate her with saint women, with Sārā and Salome, with Ḥānnā and Sofiā and may He not remember her sin and may the book of her transgressions be obliterated, Amen and Amen.Let it be, let it be. And while the greats ofBǝgwǝna were qālaṗāsAbt, pāpāsʾabunaGiyorgis andʾeṗisqoṗos Ḫarayo, ʿāqābe saʿāt MaṭāʿYǝrdǝʾanna Krǝstos, liqa diyāqonātSawǝn, qaysa gabaz ṢǝyonʾAb Yǝkun, malḥazaYǝtbārak, qas ḥaṣinZa-’Adonāya, ṣawar nārge ma’āsareKrǝstos Bǝna, ṣaḥaf lāmSǝbḥat, ḥasgwāYǝ‘ǝqabanna, mā’ǝkala bāḥrʾAsgada, ‘aqā ṣanṣanBārā Ṣeyon, ‘aqāb dage māsarayYǝmḥaranna, liqa ’aqqaytātZara Wǝdǝm, while liqa kenotZa-ʾAmalāy and while liqa ḫǝdārYāmo, liqa masanqoWalda Bǝgwǝnāy. Thus at that time I promoted this gwǝlt given by Lālibālā, lover of God, without taxation or forced labour; who will restrain this gwǝlt, shall that one be excommunicated, Amen. This was written upon the request of ʿāqābe saʿāt Maṭāʿ, [named] at birth Yǝrdǝʾanna Krǝstos and at entering monkhood as Ṣaggā Maṭāʿ. Relent that one who requested to write [this] and that one who wrote [this] and bless us, Amen.

ab.seg: በአኰቴተ፡አብ፡ወወልድ፡ወመንፈስ፡ቅዱስ።
ወሀብኩ፡አነ፡ይርድአነ፡ክርስቶስ፡ብጕናይ፡ዘጽላላ፡ዐቃቤ፡ሰዐተ፡መጣዕ፡

ገራውሀ፡በቢሓት፡፴፪፡ከመ፡ይትወሰኒ፡መጣዕ፡በመንግሥተ፡ሰማያት፡ወሀብኩ፡ለመጣዕ፡ለመባእ፡ዘዋህበኒ፡በዐለ፡ምድራ፡ሠሚሮ፡ወፈቲዎ፡ወልደ፡ማእከሊ፡ዘእመረ፡ዘአልቦ፡ዘተአገሎ፡ዘተኀየሎ፡ለመጣዕ፡እመሂ፡ሥዩም፡ወእመሂ፡ስዑር፡ውጉዘ፡ለይኩን፡በዝ፡ዓለም፡ወበዘ፡ይመጽእ፡ዓለም፡ውጉዘ፡ለይኩን፡በአፉሁ፡ለአቡነ፡መጣዕ፡ወበአፈ፡ኢየሱስ፡ክርስቶስ፡አሜን።ይኩን፡ለይኩን። ። ።
To the glory of the Father and the Son and the Holy Spirit,
I, Yǝrdǝʾanna Krǝstos of Bəgwənāy of Ṣəlālā, ‘aqābe sa‘āta Maṭā‘gave

thirty two fields of Biḥāt, to be granted by Maṭā‘ in the Heavenly Kingdom. I gave to Maṭā‘ as a donation what Walda Ma’əkali, the lord of the land, gave me agreeing and willing, who knows that what I took was not by force or violence. If someone would violate or defraud Maṭā‘, whether appointed or whether displaced, be excommunicated, in this world and in the coming world, by the mouth of Maṭā‘ and by the mouth of Jesus Christ. Amen. Let it be, let it be.

ሁ፡ጸጋ፡መጣዕ፡ ለዘአጽሐፈ፡ስረዩ፡ወባርኩነ፡ኣሜን።

And while two were united, KingLālibālāandhis wifeMasqal Kǝbrabaʾalt of Biḥat, so that it become salvation of their souls in the Heavenly Kingdom, and for my wife may it associate her with saint
women, with Sārā and Salome, with Ḥānnā and Sofiā and may her sin not to be remembered and may the book of her transgressions be obliterated, Amen and Amen.Let it be, let it be. And while the greats were in strike, qālaṗāsAbt, pāpāsʾabunaGiyorgis andʾeṗisqoṗos Ḫarayo, ʿāqābe saʿāt MaṭāʿYǝrdǝʾanna Krǝstos, liqa diyāqonātSawǝn, qaysa gabaz ṢǝyonʾAb Yǝkun, malḥazaYǝtbārak, qas ḥaṣinZa-’Adonāya, ṣawar nārge ma’āsareKrǝstos Bǝna, ṣaḥaf lāmSǝbḥat, ḥasgwā Yǝ‘ǝqabanna, mā’ǝkala bāḥrʾAsgada, ‘ǝqā ṣanṣanBārā Ṣeyon, ‘aqāb dage māsarayYǝmḥaranna, liqa ’aqqaytātZara Wǝdǝm, while liqa kenotZa-ʾAmalāy and while liqa ḫǝdārYāmo, liqa masanqoWalda Bǝgwǝnāy. Thus at that time I promoted this gwǝlt given by Lālibālā, lover of God, without taxation or forced labour; who will restrain this gwǝlt, shall that one be excommunicated, Amen. This was written upon the request of ʿāqābe saʿāt Maṭāʿ, [named] at birth Yǝrdǝʾanna Krǝstos and at entering monkhood
as Ṣaggā Maṭāʿ. Relent that one who requested to write [this] and bless us, Amen.
